questions.question: Which modern architectural marvel in the Middle East stands as the tallest structure in the world as of its completion in 2010?
questions.context: This skyscraper is part of a new development called Downtown Dubai and holds numerous records, including the highest number of stories and occupied floors.

questions.question: Which historical battle site in Belgium is known for its decisive defeat of Napoleon Bonaparte?
questions.context: On June 18, 1815, Napoleon was defeated here by the Duke of Wellington, marking the end of the Napoleonic Wars.

questions.question: What museum in France houses the famous painting 'Mona Lisa' and is one of the largest art museums in the world?
questions.context: Originally a royal palace, it became a public museum after the French Revolution and is known for its iconic glass pyramid entrance.

questions.question: Which ancient ruin in Greece is a UNESCO World Heritage Site and considered the birthplace of democracy?
questions.context: This ancient citadel on a rocky outcrop above Athens includes the Parthenon and has monuments dating back to the 5th century BC.

questions.question: Which space exploration site in the United States was the launch location for the first manned mission to land on the moon?
questions.context: Located on Merritt Island, it has been the primary launch site for human spaceflight since 1968, including the Apollo 11 mission.
